subject: Communication
title: The Toulmin Model: How Real Arguments Work
description: One-minute skill: The Toulmin Model: How Real Arguments Work.

hook.text: Formal logic works in philosophy class. In real life, arguments are messier.

buildup.text: Toulmin's model: Claim (what you assert), Data (evidence), Warrant (why the data supports the claim), Backing.

discovery.text: The warrant is the hidden key. 'The roads are icy (data), so drive slowly (claim)' â€” the warrant is 'icy roads cause.

twist.text: Most arguments fail at the warrant â€” the unstated assumption connecting evidence to conclusion.

climax.text: Toulmin's model is used in law, debate, and academic writing. It's practical logic for a messy, real world.

punchline.text: Every argument hides an assumption. Find it, and you find the argument's.

quiz.question: What is the 'warrant' in Toulmin's argument model?
options: The unstated assumption linking data to claim
